In volume 2, p. 416, the chronicler refers to the destruction of Arequipa by the eruption of the Huaynaputina volcano as a result of divine punishment. The people who managed to save themselves did so thanks to their prayers addressed to the Virgin, the saints and the angels. According to Poma de Ayala, Arequipa was devastated by fire, but in one of the images of that city and Arica that his work includes (volume 2, pp. 397 and 399) , he also refers to the ash that for days prevented seeing the sky in both cities.
